ygData.subject: RE: Faction in Rivervale
ygData.msgSnippet: Thanks for the advice... but.. Mangler will attack you even if you stay out of the shop.  If someone trains him to the open areas, and zones, he will attack
ygData.messageBody:
Thanks for the advice...

but..

Mangler will attack you even if you stay out of the shop. If someone trains
him to the open areas, and zones, he will attack the next person available.
The only solution is to zone.

Mooto gives good faction, but not with the Merchants Of Vale.

WHo do I hand belts to?


-----Original Message-----
From: Kurt Walther [mailto:itzkurt@...]
Sent: 1999/10/18 2:03 PM
To: EQ-Clerics@onelist.com
Subject: Re: [EQ-Clerics] Faction in Rivervale


From: "Kurt Walther" <itzkurt@...>

It is very easy to get up faction in Rivervale..

1. Stop killing Mangler.. the only way he attacks you is if you go in the
back room of Kevlin Diggs shop (which you don't need to unless you're a
rogue trying to complete a quest). If Mangler does attack you zone out so
you don't take the faction hit.

2. Not sure what lvl you are, but kill Mooto if you can. He gives great
faction.

3. Continue to hand in RE warbeads and orc centurion belts.

4. After Misty thicket stops giving you exp, head over to Beholder's Maze.
It gives good exp and it still raises the same factions as Misty. Same
goes with Runnyeye once Beholder gets too easy for ya.

BTW.. you don't have to buy your spells from Rivervale.. go somewhere else
if it's a must.
